intro: Stellilabium pampatamboense, commonly known as the Andean star-labium, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique, star-shaped floral structure. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous terrain. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
